subject: TIEMPO-323 Update: You may need CALBEAF ticket for AF work
body:
Hey Fulton,

Quick clarification on TIEMPO-323:

## TICKET STRUCTURE:
- ðŸ“‹ TIEMPO-323: Overall bug tracker (frontend perspective)
- ðŸ”§ CALBEAF-XXX: You'll likely need YOUR OWN ticket for Azure Functions investigation

This is a cross-project bug:
- Frontend (me): TIEMPO-323 tracks what we see
- Azure Functions (you): Need CALBEAF ticket for your investigation/fixes
- Backend (Ben): Might need CALBE ticket if database issue

## WHY SEPARATE TICKETS:
- TIEMPO-323 = "We can't see logs in PROD" (my problem)
- CALBEAF-XXX = "Fix PROD environment config/logging" (your fix)
- Different repos, different tracking, but SAME BUG

## SUGGESTED APPROACH:
1. You create CALBEAF ticket: "PROD logging not writing to database - investigate environment config"
2. Link CALBEAF-XXX to TIEMPO-323 (related issues)
3. We coordinate: I test frontend, you fix Azure Functions
4. Both tickets close when PROD logging works

## YOUR CALBEAF TICKET SHOULD COVER:
- Check PROD Azure Functions environment variables
- Verify database connection strings (PROD vs TEST)
- Fix any cross-environment data leakage
- Test PROD AF endpoints writing to correct database
- Document PROD vs TEST config differences

Gotan mentioned we're collaborating on this, so:
- I handle TIEMPO-323 (frontend testing/verification)
- You handle CALBEAF-XXX (Azure Functions fix)
- We coordinate through agent-messages

Make sense? Want me to help draft your CALBEAF ticket description?

â€” Sarah
